csi300.name: CSI 300
csi300.description: China's benchmark equity index (top 300 A-shares). Rising = domestic and foreign capital returning to Chinese markets.

hsi.name: Hang Seng Index
hsi.description: Hong Kong's benchmark: the offshore window into Chinese equities. More sensitive to global capital flows and foreign sentiment than onshore CSI 300.

kweb.name: China Internet ETF
kweb.description: KraneShares China Internet ETF: Alibaba, Tencent, PDD, etc. Rising = foreign confidence in Chinese tech improving.

inda.name: India ETF (INDA)
inda.description: iShares MSCI India ETF. Tracks large and mid-cap Indian equities. India is the fastest-growing major economy with strong demographics and manufacturing push (Make in India).

ilf.name: Latin America ETF (ILF)
ilf.description: iShares Latin America 40 ETF. Tracks Brazil, Mexico, Chile, Colombia. Commodity-rich region benefiting from nearshoring (Mexico) and resource nationalism.

eem.name: MSCI Emerging Markets ETF
eem.description: Broad EM equity benchmark. Rising = capital flowing into developing markets. EM outperforming DM = dollar weakness + fragmentation trade working.

china_pmi.name: China Mfg PMI
china_pmi.description: NBS Manufacturing PMI. Above 50 = expansion, below 50 = contraction. Sustained above 51 confirms recovery; below 49 signals deepening weakness.

china_retail_sales.name: China Retail Sales YoY
china_retail_sales.description: Monthly YoY growth in Chinese retail sales (NBS). Rising = consumer recovery gaining traction. Needs to sustain 4%+ to confirm consumption pivot.

china_cpi.name: China CPI YoY
china_cpi.description: Year-over-year change in China consumer prices. Negative = deflation risk, the #1 macro worry for China bulls. Sustained positive CPI needed to confirm reflation thesis.

china_gdp.name: China GDP YoY
china_gdp.description: China real GDP year-over-year growth rate. Headline execution metric for the 15-year plan. Target ~5%. Sustained above-target growth validates the re-rating thesis.

china_m2.name: China M2 YoY
china_m2.description: China broad money supply year-over-year growth. M2 > 10% = PBOC actively stimulating. Rising M2 is a leading indicator for credit impulse and asset reflation.
